00051     /**
00052      * Returns an age.
00053      * 
00054      * This method returns an age, calculated from a timestamp. By default,
00055      * the method takes the current time as reference, but another timestamp
00056      * can be specified. The method also returns by default the age in days,
00057      * but it can also returns it in seconds, minutes or hours.
00058      * 
00059      * @param   int     The base timestamp
00060      * @param   int     The time from which to calculate the age (timestamp). Will use current time if none supplied
00061      * @param   string  The type of age to return (s = seconds, i = minutes, h = hours, or d = days). Default is days.
00062      * @return  int     An age, as a numeric value
00063      */
00064     public static function calcAge( $tstamp, $curTime = false, $ageType = false )
00065     {
00066         // Process age types
00067         switch( $ageType ) {
00068             
00069             // Seconds
00070             case 's':
00071                 $division = 1;
00072                 break;
00073             
00074             // Minutes
00075             case 'i':
00076                 $division = 60;
00077                 break;
00078             
00079             // Hours
00080             case 'h':
00081                 $division = 3600;
00082                 break;
00083             
00084             // Default - Days
00085             default:
00086                 $division = 86400;
00087                 break;
00088         }
00089         
00090         // Gets the current time, if none specified
00091         if( !$currentTime ) {
00092             
00093             $currentTime = time();
00094         }
00095         
00096         // Gets the differences between the two timestamps
00097         $diff = $currentTime - $tstamp;
00098         
00099         // Returns the age
00100         return ceil( $diff / $division );
00101     }

00103     /**
00104      * Converts a week number to a timestamp.
00105      * 
00106      * This method returns a timestamp for a given year (XXXX), week number, and
00107      * day number (0 is sunday, 6 is saturday).
00108      * 
00109      * Thanx to Nicolas Miroz for the informations about date computing.
00110      * 
00111      * @param   int The day number
00112      * @param   int The week number
00113      * @param   int The year
00114      * @return  int A timestamp
00115      */
00116     public static function weekToDate( $day, $week, $year )
00117     {
00118         // First january of the year
00119         $firstDay = mktime( 0, 0, 0, 1, 1, $year );
00120         
00121         // Gets the day for the first january
00122         $firstDayNum = date( 'w', $firstDay );
00123         
00124         // Computes the first monday of the year and the week number for that day
00125         switch( $firstDayNum ) {
00126         
00127             // Sunday
00128             case 0:
00129                 
00130                 // Monday is 02.01 | Week is 1
00131                 $monday = mktime( 0, 0, 0, 01, 02, $year );
00132                 $weekNum = 1;
00133                 break;
00134             
00135             // Monday
00136             case 1:
00137                 
00138                 // Monday is 01.01 | Week is 1
00139                 $monday = mktime( 0, 0, 0, 01, 01, $year );
00140                 $weekNum = 1;
00141                 break;
00142             
00143             // Tuesday
00144             case 2:
00145                 
00146                 // Monday is 07.01 | Week is 2
00147                 $monday = mktime( 0, 0, 0, 01, 07, $year );
00148                 $weekNum = 2;
00149                 break;
00150             
00151             // Wednesday
00152             case 3:
00153                 
00154                 // Monday is 06.01 | Week is 2
00155                 $monday = mktime( 0, 0, 0, 01, 06, $year );
00156                 $weekNum = 2;
00157                 break;
00158             
00159             // Thursday
00160             case 4:
00161                 
00162                 // Monday is 05.01 | Week is 2
00163                 $monday = mktime( 0, 0, 0, 01, 05, $year );
00164                 $weekNum = 2;
00165                 break;
00166             
00167             // Friday
00168             case 5:
00169                 
00170                 // Monday is 04.01 | Week is 1
00171                 $monday = mktime( 0, 0, 0, 01, 04, $year );
00172                 $weekNum = 1;
00173                 break;
00174             
00175             // Saturday
00176             case 6:
00177                 
00178                 // Monday is 03.01 | Week is 1
00179                 $monday = mktime( 0, 0, 0, 01, 03, $year );
00180                 $weekNum = 1;
00181                 break;
00182         }
00183         
00184         // Computes the difference in days from the monday to the requested day
00185         $dayDiff = ( $day == 0 ) ? 6 : ( $day - 1 );
00186         
00187         // Number of day to the requested date
00188         $numDay = ( ( $week - ( $weekNum - 1 ) - 1 ) * 7 ) + $dayDiff + date( 'd', $monday );
00189         
00190         // Creates and returns the timestamp for the requested date
00191         return mktime( 0, 0, 0, 01, $numDay, $year );
00192     }
